de.szut.dqi12.cheftrainer.server.databasecommunication

Class PointManagement

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.szut.dqi12.cheftrainer.server.databasecommunication.PointManagement

  • public class PointManagement
extends java.lang.Object
    This cless is used to send Query to the database to update the points of players.
    Author:
    Alexander Brennecke

        public PointManagement(SQLConnection sqlCon)
        Constructor

    • Method Detail

      • updatePointsOfPlayers

        public void updatePointsOfPlayers(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Player> playerList)
        This function updates the Points of the Players in the given list. The points, defined in the given Player object will be added to the points stored in the database.
        Parameters:
        playerList - a Map, where the key is a String and the value is a Player object. The Keys are not relevant.

      • addPointsToPlayingPlayers

        public void addPointsToPlayingPlayers(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Player> playerList)
        This function saves the given points in the "Mannschaft Copy" table.
        Parameters:
        playerList - a List where a String is the key (name of the Player) and the Player object is the value.

      • addTempPointsToManager

        public void addTempPointsToManager(int matchday)
        This function reads the "Mannschaft Copy" table, after the points were added. It then adds the points to the managers via addManagerPoints()
        Parameters:
        matchday - the current matchday

      • addManagerPoints

        public void addManagerPoints(int matchday,
                             int managerID,
                             int points)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        This function creates two queries by the given data. One for the Manager table and one for the Manager_Statistik table.
        Parameters:
        matchday - the current matchday (used for the statistics)
        managerID - the ID of a Manager
        points - the points, which were earned by the Manager at that matchday.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
